Leaves: Mostly heart-shaped to triangular in outline, weakly lobed, irregularly toothed, up to 18 cm long-stalked, with bristly hairs.
Flowers: Inconspicuous, clustered, whitish to greenish flowerheads.
FruitSeeds: Burrs 7-20 mm long, not hairy, with many hooked spines on surface and two equally long, straight beaks at the end.
DistinguishingFeatures: Differs from *Xanthium spinosum* in not having spines on the stem. Is sometimes considered to include *X. occidentale*.
